p: The CME contents of C. albicans in C. carvi EO- and fluconazole-treated cultures were measured at 0.084 and 0.064 Âµg/g, respectively ( Table 2), indicating a significant difference between the treated and control groups ( P<0.05). The CME was inhibited at the rates of 25.74% and 43.36% in C. carvi EO- and fluconazole-treated cultures, respectively. The results showed that fluconazole was more efficient than C. carvi EO in reducing the ergosterol content of C. albicans.
